fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 2: Visual. Simple Profile (formal name); MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Simple Profile (common name)

fdd:description.p: See also MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. Intended to serve mobile audio-visual services and low-complexity video for the Internet; other uses include small camera devices that record to disk or memory chips.
The Simple Profile permits the use of the following visual object type:

ul.li: Simple: rectangular video, uses intra (I) and predicted (P) video object planes (VOPs, the MPEG-4 term for frames).

fdd:description.p: The Simple Profile permits the use of three compression levels with bit rates from 64 kbps in Level 1 to 384 kbps in Level 3.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Video encoding in MPEG-4 Visual Coding family, intended to serve mobile audio-visual services and low-complexity video for the Internet; other uses include small camera devices that record to disk or memory chips.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with Visual Coding (All Profiles)

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Actual adoption not known to the compilers of this document. One indicator, however, is the specification for the video-capable iPod introduced by Apple in late 2005: MPEG-4 video up to 2.5 mbps, 480 x 480, 30 frames per sec., Simple Profile, associated with AAC_MP4_LC audio.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. Other profiles will produce greater clarity than the Simple Profile at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_V bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2, use mp42. See Part 15 of the standard, pp. 2-9, 13.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicators for Simple Profile, levels 1, 2, and 3 are 00000001, 00000010, and 00000011, respectively. From Annex G of ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004, Table G.1
